intro: Fagarastrum capense, commonly known as the Cape fagarastrum, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, oval leaves and clusters of white flowers that bloom in spring. It produces small, red berries that are edible but not particularly flavorful. Fagarastrum capense is often found in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
